Blog.post: I am out of the hole and back to even, maybe a little up actually after booking a solid night of $100+. I got really lucky in a $30+3 SnG picking up AA 4x, but I finished 2nd anyhows. Tommorow will hopefully be another winning day.

I get a free ride this time, I got a $50 Bonus for the tell-a-friend promotion, so my bankroll is back up and running, couldn't have asked for anything better....thanks a lot rich. Look for me and rckinc, we are taking over the online poker world. Off to the NO LIMT TABLES.

The Main event premiered today...some knockouts were: MoneyMaker, Farha, and John Juada. One exciting hand was when some guy picked up bullets and made it 1200 to Jesus. Jesus flopped top pair, was put all in and called, and he ended up catching trips on the river...just goes to show even the pros get lucky too. A lot of pros got caught bluffing and it really makes me think about how the game is evolving...bluffing is not an easy thing to do anymore, online or in real life vs. loose players. It is more profitable to only play the nuts, or nut draws, and attempt to bluff later on.

My bankroll was cleaned out yesterday when my QQ (hilton sisters) went down to KK. So at -$100 I have to start buiding up again. Things I will remember next time are: 1. Play at the game you have most success at...If you are losing at lot at one type of game, quit and and try another. This has been written a lot and is considered common poker knowledge, but in the heat of battle sometimes your mind is too focused to remember all the poker teaching you have read. It is definitely easy to talk yourself into thinking you are just hitting a bad run of cards, which may be true, but one thing can lead to another easily...believe me.... 2. When you bankroll is getting low, play the game that is most likely to boost your bankroll up with minimal risk. I tried to play low limit poker when my bankroll got low, but a bad run of cards can ruin you here.

I lost $250 last night playing on the $1/2 bad beat jackpot tables...what a ridiculous bad run of cards. My bankroll is holding on though at $150 and I'm currently in a $30+3 NO limit tourney where I cracked aces with my queens. Anyway I should be getting back to the tourney now.

I played some stud, stud h/l, and nl $25 last night and came out with profit in 2/3. I finished somewhere around +50. It should have been a little more but I got sucked out by a Q8o preflop caller of $10, and he caught his second 8 on the river after calling my all in preflop with mid pair of 8's. These type of players online will eventually lose their entire bankroll. The thing you have to keep in mind is that there are thousands of these suckers, and they are the players you will win the most off in the long run. One bad beat here or there should be viewed as a good thing, keeping the sucker in the game. One strategy to use vs. these players is to just play tight and aggressive and only play after the flop with the nuts or a draw to the nuts. These types of players will play almost all hands preflop, most hands preflop in the face of a preflop raise, and all or any flop that they have a caught the smallest piece off. It is also important to have discipline vs. these types of players during the hand...Never underestimate your enemy, as weak as they may be. neutiquam erro
